light. eomi. sclerae were anicteric. nares patent. oropharynx clear without any exudate or lesions. mucous membranes are slightly dry. neck: revealed no jvd, no carotid bruits, no thyromegaly. neck was supple and nontender. lungs: lungs were clear to auscultation anteriorly, bilaterally. cardiovascular: regular rate and rhythm with no audible rubs, murmurs, or gallops. abdomen: soft, nontender, nondistended with normal bowel sounds. there are no palpable masses and no hepatosplenomegaly. extremities: extremities are without any clubbing, cyanosis, or edema. toes are cool bilaterally with dopplerable dorsalis pedis pulses bilaterally. there is no evidence of calf tenderness. the calf site of the right groin is without any hematoma or oozing of blood. laboratory data: labs on admission revealed the following: white count 10, hemoglobin 12, hematocrit 36, platelet count 405,000, sodium 140, potassium 4.1, chloride 106, bicarbonate 23, bun 11, creatinine 0.9, glucose 117. ck 107, ldh notable for an iui assisted pregnancy with donor sperm to a 2-female intact couple. physical examination at discharge: notable for a well- appearing, symmetrically growth restricted infant in no apparent distress. the head circumference is 28.5 cm, the length is 39 cm, and the weight is 1400 grams. the anterior fontanel was flat and soft. the palate is intact. there is no grunting, flaring or retraction. the breath sounds are clear. there is no murmur. femoral pulses are intact. the abdomen is flat, soft and nontender without hepatosplenomegaly. the hips are stable. the phallus is normal. the testes are in the inguinal canal. the anus is patent. the tone and activity are normal. there is a normal suck. summary of hospital course by systems: respiratory: the infant did not have respiratory issues during his nicu stay. he had no apnea or bradycardia, and his saturations remained in the normal range. cardiovascular: the infant did not have any cardiovascular issues, no murmur was noted, and blood pressures were in the normal range. there was no bradycardia evident during this hospitalization. fluids, electrolytes and nutrition: the infant was initially managed with iv fluid via a double-lumen umbilical venous catheter. feedings were introduced on day 2 and gradually advanced. at the time of dictation, the infant is receiving breast milk 26 with neosure and special care 26. the infant is taking all feedings p.o. and taking as much as 156 ml/kg/d. the infant is also being breastfed. discharge weight is 1400 grams. gastrointestinal: apart from some transiently heme positive stools, there has been an unremarkable gastrointestinal course. stools are heme negative at the time of dictation. the infant received phototherapy for 3 days. the peak bilirubin was 7.9. the infant is currently anicteric. hematologic: the infant did not require transfusion. as noted above, the mother's blood type was o+, and the baby's blood type has not been tested. infectious disease: an initial cbc showed a white count of 9.8 with 41 polys and 1 band. blood culture was sent and remained no growth. the infant did not receive antibiotics. urine for cmv was sent and was negative. neurologic: the infant had a head ultrasound on [**5-26**], and it was within normal limits. sensory: the infant has not had a hearing screening test and will be due for an exam prior to discharge. the infant had a retinal examination, and the results were that the retina were immature to zone 3. follow-up was recommended in 3 weeks. the retinal exam was performed on [**6-1**]. condition on discharge: stable.
